description: The dog breed derives from the name shared by the first two breeding bitches (dam and pup), which name derives from the mythological spirit.

entries.meaning: A malevolent shapeshifting spirit, most often in the form of a horse, believed to haunt the rivers and lochs of Scotland.
examples: He was a boy in form, and an antediluvian in feature. Some thought he was a mule, between a Jew and an ape; some a wizard, some a kelpie, or a fairy, but most of all, that he was really and truly a Brownie.
Gulls scatter before the blur of my insane kelpie.
